strategies.description: An Iron Condor involves selling a call spread and a put spread on the same underlying asset with the same expiration date.
strategies.why_it_fits: This trader is experienced with spreads and has shown an ability to manage trades with multiple legs. The Iron Condor offers a defined risk-reward setup, which aligns with this trader's risk management skills.
strategies.best_conditions: Iron Condors work best in a range-bound market where the underlying asset is expected to move within a specific price range.

strategies.description: A Butterfly Spread involves buying a long call at a lower strike price, selling two calls at a middle strike price, and buying another long call at a higher strike price. All options have the same expiration date.
strategies.why_it_fits: The trader has shown an understanding of the time decay concept (Theta) in options trading. The Butterfly Spread can potentially benefit from time decay, aligning with the trader's strengths.
strategies.best_conditions: This strategy works best when the trader expects the underlying asset to remain close to the middle strike price until the options' expiration date.

strategies.description: A Long Straddle involves buying a call and a put on the same underlying asset with the same strike price and expiration date.
strategies.why_it_fits: This trader has shown adaptability in different market conditions. A Long Straddle is a strategy that can potentially profit from a significant move in either direction, offering flexibility for changing market conditions.
strategies.best_conditions: This strategy works best when high volatility is expected in the underlying asset, leading to a significant price movement.
